Having briefly repented the afflictive hindrances, we should now in order repent the karmic hindrances.
Karma can adorn the worldly paths, being present everywhere. Therefore, we contemplate seeking to leave the world and attain liberation.

The reason for the various different forms and kinds of karmic retribution in the six destinies is because they are all created by the power of karma. Therefore, among the ten powers of the Buddha, the power of karma is very profound.
Ordinary people often give rise to doubt in this regard.
Why is this so?
We currently see in the world that those who do good encounter difficulties, while those who do evil find things going smoothly.
It means saying that in the world there is no distinction between good and evil.
Those who think like this are all unable to deeply understand the principle of karma.
Why is this so?
It is said in the sutra:
There are three kinds of karma.
What are the three?
First, karma with present retribution;
second, karma with retribution in the next life;
third, karma with retribution in a later life.
Karma with present retribution means creating good or evil in the present life and receiving retribution in this body.
Karma with retribution in the next life means creating good or evil in this life and receiving retribution in the next life.
Karma with retribution in a later life means creating good or evil in the past countless lives, or receiving it in this life, or receiving the retribution in the present, future, or countless lives.

The person who previously did evil but now sees goodness is because the good karma with retribution in the next life or later life from past lives has matured, so there is this happy result in the present life. How is it related to creating various evil karma in the present life and receiving a good retribution!

Those who do good in the present life and see suffering are because the evil karma of the ripening of birth and the ripening of later lives in past lives has matured, and the power of the present wholesome roots is weak and cannot be dispelled, therefore they receive this suffering retribution, how is it related to the present doing good and attracting evil retribution?
How do we know this is so?
It is currently seen in the world that those who do good are praised by others and respected by others, therefore we know that in the future they will definitely attract happy fruits.

Since there was such evil karma in the past, therefore the buddhas and bodhisattvas teach to be close to good friends and together practice repentance. A good and virtuous friend is completely beneficial in attaining the Way.
Therefore, disciples!
Today with utmost sincerity take refuge in the Buddha.

The Sutra of the Monk Baodai's Questions and Answers on Retribution, a Mahayana Lotus Treasure. Baodai entered a boiling excrement hell.
Why is it called the boiling excrement hell?

The hell is sixty yojanas long and wide, surrounded by iron walls and covered with an iron net, with excrement flowing east and west and north and south, with fire coming out from it, smoke and flames rising together like clouds and rain, extremely foul-smelling, the foulest of the foul.
In the north gate, there are six hundred monks who enter there, wailing and weeping, with fire coming out of their mouths and eyes, also without rest.

They enter this cesspool and drink the excrement and urine, with flames of fire coming out of their mouths and excrement and urine, and the same happens to their mouths, eyes, and six sense organs, dying a thousand times and being reborn a thousand times, dying ten thousand times and being reborn ten thousand times.
Baota asked the horse-headed rakshasa:
For what causes and conditions did these monks fall into this hell?
The horse-headed rakshasa replied:
These monks received the Buddha's pure precepts but did not uphold them purely. They indulged in alcohol and meat and ate the five pungent plants, falling into this hell.
When Baota heard this, he wept sorrowfully and left.
